name: markdown-kanban-obsidian
description: Kanban board for Markdown files, compatible with obsidian kanban boards

markdown-kanban.pathGeneration.description: How to generate file paths when creating links from drag & drop, clipboard, and link replacement
enumDescriptions: Generate relative paths from the current document

markdown-kanban.openLinksInNewTab.description: Open file links in new tabs instead of replacing the current editor

markdown-kanban.taskMinHeight.description: The minimum height for task cards (e.g., 'auto', '200px', '400px', '43.5vh', '89vh')
enumDescriptions: Minimum height of 43.5% of viewport height
Minimum height of 89% of viewport height

markdown-kanban.sectionMaxHeight.description: Maximum height for content sections between horizontal rules (HRs) in task descriptions
enumDescriptions: No height limit (automatic based on content)

markdown-kanban.whitespace.description: The amount of whitespace-padding to use in the Kanban board (e.g., '4px', '8px', '2px')
markdown-kanban.whitespace.patternErrorMessage: Please enter a valid CSS size value (e.g., '4px', '0.5em', '1rem')

markdown-kanban.fontSize.description: The font size for task cards and content

markdown-kanban.fontFamily.description: The font family for task cards and content

markdown-kanban.layoutRows.description: The number of rows in the kanban layout

markdown-kanban.maxRowHeight.description: Maximum height for kanban rows in pixels. Set to 0 for unlimited height (full card height). Other values limit the row height.

markdown-kanban.stickyStackMode.description: Control sticky positioning behavior in column stacks
enumDescriptions: Header, title, footer & margin all sticky (original behavior)

markdown-kanban.tagVisibility.description: Control which types of tags are displayed on cards
enumDescriptions: Show all tags including #span, #row, and @ tags
Show only custom tags (not configured ones) and @ tags

markdown-kanban.showHtmlComments.description: Show HTML comments (<!-- -->) as visible markers in the kanban view

markdown-kanban.arrowKeyFocusScroll.description: How arrow key navigation scrolls focused items into view
enumDescriptions: Center the focused item in the viewport
Scroll just enough to bring the item into view

markdown-kanban.layoutPresets.description: Custom layout presets configuration. Each preset should contain a 'label', 'description', and 'settings' object with layout options.

description.description: Description of what this preset does

markdown-kanban.tagColors.description: Grouped color and style configuration for tags in kanban boards with various visual indicators.

markdown-kanban.tagCategoryReference.markdownDescription:
## Tag Category Reference

All 21 tag categories available for both columns and tasks. Each category uses consistent styling:

### Column-Optimized Categories (headerBar + border)
- `workflow` - Workflow stages: ideas, outline, draft, review, polish, ready, published, active, testing, production, archive
- `organization` - Organization: intro, core, advanced, frontend, backend, infrastructure, design
- `content-type-teaching` - Teaching content: slide, video, reading, exercise, quiz, demo, interactive, handout, discussion  
- `content-type-product` - Product content: story, task, chore, improvement, design, infrastructure-task
- `complexity` - Complexity levels: trivial, beginner, intermediate, advanced-level, expert

### Task-Optimized Categories (cornerBadge + background)
- `priority` - Priority levels: urgent, high, medium, low, delayed, stopped
- `status` - Status states: todo, inprogress, done, blocked, testing, wip, cancelled, archived
- `review-status` - Review states: needs-review, in-review, needs-changes, reviewed, needs-approval, approved, rejected
- `time-estimate` - Time estimates: quick, medium-time, long
- `testing-status` - Testing states: untested, unit-tested, integration-tested, e2e-tested, security-tested, performance-tested, regression-tested, uat-passed
- `platform-teaching` - Teaching platforms: online, in-person, hybrid, async, sync
- `platform-product` - Product platforms: web, mobile, ios, android, desktop, api
- `version` - Version tags: v1, v2, v3, rc, stable, legacy, eol
- `impact` - Impact levels: minor, moderate, major, breaking

### Universal Categories (work on both)
- `importance` - Importance: critical, normal
- `type` - Item types: bug, feature, enhancement, documentation, epic, spike, refactor
- `category` - Technical areas: backend, frontend, database, api, security, performance, ux, ui

### Color Categories (background only)
- `dark-colors` - 12 dark colors: dark-red, dark-orange, dark-yellow, dark-green, dark-cyan, dark-blue, dark-purple, dark-pink, dark-brown, dark-gray, black, dark-charcoal
- `colors` - 12 normal colors: red, orange, yellow, green, cyan, blue, purple, pink, brown, gray, teal, indigo
- `light-colors` - 12 light colors: light-red, light-orange, light-yellow, light-green, light-cyan, light-blue, light-purple, light-pink, light-brown, light-gray, white, light-beige
- `accessible-colors` - 8 WCAG colors: accessible-indigo (#332288), accessible-green (#117733), accessible-teal (#44AA99), accessible-cyan (#88CCEE), accessible-yellow (#DDCC77), accessible-rose (#CC6677), accessible-purple (#AA4499), accessible-magenta (#882255)

markdown-kanban.enabledTagCategoriesColu.markdownDescription:
**Column Tag Categories** - Select which categories appear in column burger menus. All 21 categories available. See 'Tag Category Reference' above for details.

**Column Defaults (9):** workflow, organization, importance, type, category, colors, content-type-teaching, content-type-product, complexity

markdown-kanban.enabledTagCategoriesTask.markdownDescription:
**Task Tag Categories** - Select which categories appear in task burger menus. All 21 categories available. See 'Tag Category Reference' above for details.

**Task Defaults (12):** priority, status, importance, type, colors, review-status, time-estimate, testing-status, platform-teaching, platform-product, version, impact

markdown-kanban.customTagCategories.description: Define custom tag categories. Each category should map category name to tag configurations. Example: {"myCategory": {"myTag": {"border": {"color": "#FF0000", "width": "2px", "style": "solid", "position": "full"}}}}

additionalProperties.description: Custom tag category containing tag definitions
Tag configuration with styling properties (border, headerBar, footerBar, cornerBadge, light, dark, etc.)

markdown-kanban.columnBorder.description: Complete border style for columns (e.g., '1px solid var(--vscode-panel-border)', '1px dashed red', 'none'). Full CSS border shorthand supported.

markdown-kanban.taskBorder.description: Complete border style for task cards (e.g., '1px solid var(--vscode-panel-border)', '2px dotted blue', 'none'). Full CSS border shorthand supported.

markdown-kanban.enableBackups.description: Enable automatic backups of kanban files

markdown-kanban.backupInterval.description: Interval in minutes between automatic backups (1-60 minutes)

enumDescriptions: Store backups in the same folder as the original file
Store backups in a .backups folder in the workspace root
Store backups in a custom location (set customBackupPath)

markdown-kanban.maxBackupsPerFile.description: Maximum number of backups to keep per file (older backups will be deleted)

scripts.compile: npm run check-types && npm run lint && node esbuild.js
scripts.package: npm run check-types && npm run lint && node esbuild.js --production
scripts.pretest: npm run compile-tests && npm run compile && npm run lint
